intro: Schmaltzia standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or blue. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Schmaltzia standleyi is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
